explanation: The condition incorrectly used x>a+1 which wrongly excluded the case x == a+1. The intended range is a < x <= b, so the check should be x > a and x <= b. I changed that single condition to include values immediately greater than a.
fixed_code:
a,b,c,x=list(map(int,input().split()))
ans=1.0
if x>a and x<=b:
    ans=c/(b-a)
elif x>b:
    ans=0.0
print('%.10f'%ans)
